ai-chat-completions.name: Compute chat completions
ai-chat-completions.description: Sends the messages to the AI Service to compute chat completions. The result is stored in the specified field.

ai-service.description: In case of multiple AI services configured, specify the id of the AI service to use.

completion-field.description: Field to use to store the completion results in the output topic. Use "value" to write the result without a structured schema. Use "value.<field>" to write the result in a specific field.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

frequency-penalty.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

log-field.description:
Field to use to store the log of the completion results in the output topic. Use "value" to write the result without a structured schema. Use "value.<field>" to write the result in a specific field.
The log contains useful information for debugging the completion prompts.

logit-bias.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

max-tokens.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

messages.description: Messages to use for chat completions. You can use the Mustache syntax.

items.description: Messages to use for chat completions. You can use the Mustache syntax.

role.description: Role of the message. The role is used to identify the speaker in the chat.

content.description: Content of the message. You can use the Mustache syntax.

min-chunks-per-message.description:
Minimum number of chunks to send to the stream-to-topic topic. The chunks are sent as soon as they are available.
The chunks are sent in the order they are received from the AI Service.
To improve the TTFB (Time-To-First-Byte), the chunk size starts from 1 and doubles until it reaches the max-chunks-per-message value.

model.description: The model to use for chat completions. The model must be available in the AI Service.

presence-penalty.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

stop.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

items.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

stream.description: Enable streaming of the results. Use in conjunction with the stream-to-topic parameter.

stream-response-completion-field.description: Field to use to store the completion results in the stream-to-topic topic. Use "value" to write the result without a structured schema. Use "value.<field>" to write the result in a specific field.

stream-to-topic.description: Enable streaming of the results. If enabled, the results are streamed to the specified topic in small chunks. The entire messages will be sent to the output topic instead.

temperature.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

top-p.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

user.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

ai-text-completions.name: Compute text completions
ai-text-completions.description: Sends the text to the AI Service to compute text completions. The result is stored in the specified field.

ai-service.description: In case of multiple AI services configured, specify the id of the AI service to use.

completion-field.description: Field to use to store the completion results in the output topic. Use "value" to write the result without a structured schema. Use "value.<field>" to write the result in a specific field.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

frequency-penalty.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

log-field.description:
Field to use to store the log of the completion results in the output topic. Use "value" to write the result without a structured schema. Use "value.<field>" to write the result in a specific field.
The log contains useful information for debugging the completion prompts.

logit-bias.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

max-tokens.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

min-chunks-per-message.description:
Minimum number of chunks to send to the stream-to-topic topic. The chunks are sent as soon as they are available.
The chunks are sent in the order they are received from the AI Service.
To improve the TTFB (Time-To-First-Byte), the chunk size starts from 1 and doubles until it reaches the max-chunks-per-message value.

model.description: The model to use for text completions. The model must be available in the AI Service.

presence-penalty.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

prompt.description: Prompt to use for text completions. You can use the Mustache syntax.

items.description: Prompt to use for text completions. You can use the Mustache syntax.

stop.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

items.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

stream.description: Enable streaming of the results. Use in conjunction with the stream-to-topic parameter.

stream-response-completion-field.description: Field to use to store the completion results in the stream-to-topic topic. Use "value" to write the result without a structured schema. Use "value.<field>" to write the result in a specific field.

stream-to-topic.description: Enable streaming of the results. If enabled, the results are streamed to the specified topic in small chunks. The entire messages will be sent to the output topic instead.

temperature.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

top-p.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

user.description: Parameter for the completion request. The parameters are passed to the AI Service as is.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

azure-blob-storage-source.name: Azure Blob Storage Source
azure-blob-storage-source.description:
Reads data from Azure blobs. There are three supported ways to authenticate:
- SAS token
- Storage account name and key
- Storage account connection string

container.description: The name of the Azure econtainer to read from.

endpoint.description: Endpoint to connect to. Usually it's https://<storage-account>.blob.core.windows.net.

file-extensions.description: Comma separated list of file extensions to filter by.

idle-time.description: Time in seconds to sleep after polling for new files.

sas-token.description: Azure SAS token. If not provided, storage account name and key must be provided.

storage-account-connection-string.description: Azure storage account connection string. If not provided, SAS token must be provided.

storage-account-key.description: Azure storage account key. If not provided, SAS token must be provided.

storage-account-name.description: Azure storage account name. If not provided, SAS token must be provided.

cast.name: Cast record to another schema
cast.description:
Transforms the data to a target compatible schema.
Some step operations like cast or compute involve conversions from a type to another. When this happens the rules are:
    - timestamp, date and time related object conversions assume UTC time zone if it is not explicit.
    - date and time related object conversions to/from STRING use the RFC3339 format.
    - timestamp related object conversions to/from LONG and DOUBLE are done using the number of milliseconds since EPOCH (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z).
    - date related object conversions to/from INTEGER, LONG, FLOAT and DOUBLE are done using the number of days since EPOCH (1970-01-01).
    - time related object conversions to/from INTEGER, LONG and DOUBLE are done using the number of milliseconds since midnight (00:00:00).

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

part.description: When used with KeyValue data, defines if the transformation is done on the key or on the value. If empty, the transformation applies to both the key and the value.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

compute.name: Compute values from the record
compute.description: Computes new properties, values or field values based on an expression evaluated at runtime. If the field already exists, it will be overwritten.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

fields.description: An array of objects describing how to calculate the field values

items.description: An array of objects describing how to calculate the field values

expression.description:
It is evaluated at runtime and the result of the evaluation is assigned to the field.
Refer to the language expression documentation for more information on the expression syntax.

name.description:
The name of the field to be computed. Prefix with key. or value. to compute the fields in the key or value parts of the message.
In addition, you can compute values on the following message headers [destinationTopic, messageKey, properties.].
Please note that properties is a map of key/value pairs that are referenced by the dot notation, for example properties.key0.

optional.description: If true, it marks the field as optional in the schema of the transformed message. This is useful when null is a possible value of the compute expression.

type.description:
The type of the computed field. This
 will translate to the schema type of the new field in the transformed message.
 The following types are currently supported :STRING, INT8, INT16, INT32, INT64, FLOAT, DOUBLE, BOOLEAN, DATE, TIME, TIMESTAMP, LOCAL_DATE_TIME, LOCAL_TIME, LOCAL_DATE, INSTANT.
  The type field is not required for the message headers [destinationTopic, messageKey, properties.] and STRING will be used.
  For the value and key, if it is not provided, then the type will be inferred from the result of the expression evaluation.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

compute-ai-embeddings.name: Compute embeddings of the record
compute-ai-embeddings.description: Compute embeddings of the record. The embeddings are stored in the record under a specific field.

ai-service.description: In case of multiple AI services configured, specify the id of the AI service to use.

arguments.description: Additional arguments to pass to the AI Service. (HuggingFace only)

batch-size.description: Batch size for submitting the embeddings requests.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

concurrency.description: Max number of concurrent requests to the AI Service.

embeddings-field.description: Field where to store the embeddings.

flush-interval.description:
Flushing is disabled by default in order to avoid latency spikes.
You should enable this feature in the case of background processing.

loop-over.description: Execute the agent over a list of documents

model.description: Model to use for the embeddings. The model must be available in the configured AI Service.

modelUrl.description: URL of the model to use. (HuggingFace only). The default is computed from the model: "djl://ai.djl.huggingface.pytorch{model}"

options.description: Additional options to pass to the AI Service. (HuggingFace only)

text.description:
Text to create embeddings from. You can use Mustache syntax to compose multiple fields into a single text. Example:
text: "{{{ value.field1 }}} {{{ value.field2 }}}"

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

dispatch.name: Dispatch agent
dispatch.description: Dispatches messages to different destinations based on conditions.

items.description: Routes.

action.description: Action on the message. Possible values are "dispatch" or "drop".

when.description: Condition to activate the route. This is a standard EL expression.

document-to-json.name: Document to JSON
document-to-json.description: Convert raw text document to JSON. The result will be a JSON object with the text content in the specified field.

copy-properties.description: Whether to copy the message properties/headers in the output message.

text-field.description: Field name to write the text content to.

drop.name: Drop the record
drop.description: Drops the record from further processing. Use in conjunction with when to selectively drop records.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

fields.description: Fields to drop from the input record.

items.description: Fields to drop from the input record.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

flare-controller.name: Flare Controller
flare-controller.description: Apply to the Flare pattern to enhance the quality of text completion results.

logprobs-field.description: The field that contains the logprobs of tokens returned by the ai-text-completion agent.

loop-topic.description: Name of the topic to forward the message in case of requesting more documents.

retrieve-documents-field.description: Name of the field to set in order to request the retrival of more documents.

tokens-field.description: The field that contains the list of tokens returned by the ai-text-completion agent.

flatten.name: Flatten record fields
flatten.description: Converts structured nested data into a new single-hierarchy-level structured data. The names of the new fields are built by concatenating the intermediate level field names.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

delimiter.description: The delimiter to use when concatenating the field names.

part.description: When used with KeyValue data, defines if the transformation is done on the key or on the value. If empty, the transformation applies to both the key and the value.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

http-request.name: Http Request
http-request.description: Agent for enriching data with an HTTP request.

allow-redirects.description: Whether or not to follow redirects.

body.description: Body to send with the request. You can use the Mustache syntax to inject value from the context.

handle-cookies.description: Whether or not to handle cookies during the redirects.

headers.description: Headers to send with the request. You can use the Mustache syntax to inject value from the context.

method.description: Http method to use for the request.

output-field.description: The field that will hold the results, it can be the same as "field" to override it.

query-string.description:
Query string to append to the url. You can use the Mustache syntax to inject value from the context.
Note that the values will be automatically escaped.

url.description: Url to send the request to. For adding query string parameters, use the `query-string` field.

identity.name: Identity function
identity.description: Simple agent to move data from the input to the output. Could be used for testing or sample applications.

language-detector.name: Language detector
language-detector.description: Detect the language of a messageâ€™s data and limit further processing based on language codes.

allowedLanguages.description: Define a list of allowed language codes. If the message language is not in this list, the message is dropped.

items.description: Define a list of allowed language codes. If the message language is not in this list, the message is dropped.

property.description: The name of the message header to write the language code to.

merge-key-value.name: Merge key-value format
merge-key-value.description: Merges the fields of KeyValue records where both the key and value are structured types of the same schema type. Only AVRO and JSON are supported.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

python-function.name: Python custom processor
python-function.description:
Run a your own Python processor.
All the configuration properties are available the class init method.

className.description: Python class name to instantiate. This class must be present in the application's "python" files.

python-processor.name: Python custom processor
python-processor.description:
Run a your own Python processor.
All the configuration properties are available the class init method.

className.description: Python class name to instantiate. This class must be present in the application's "python" files.

python-sink.name: Python custom sink
python-sink.description:
Run a your own Python sink.
All the configuration properties are available in the class init method.

className.description: Python class name to instantiate. This class must be present in the application's "python" files.

python-source.name: Python custom source
python-source.description:
Run a your own Python source.
All the configuration properties are available in the class init method.

className.description: Python class name to instantiate. This class must be present in the application's "python" files.

query.name: Query
query.description: Perform a vector search or simple query against a datasource.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

fields.description: Fields of the record to use as input parameters for the query.

items.description: Fields of the record to use as input parameters for the query.

loop-over.description:
Loop over a list of items taken from the record. For instance value.documents.
It must refer to a list of maps. In this case the output-field parameter
but be like "record.fieldname" in order to replace or set a field in each record
with the results of the query. In the query parameters you can refer to the
record fields using "record.field".

only-first.description: If true, only the first result of the query is stored in the output field.

output-field.description: The name of the field to use to store the query result.

query.description: The query to use to extract the data.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

query-vector-db.name: Query a vector database
query-vector-db.description: Query a vector database using Vector Search capabilities.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

fields.description: Fields of the record to use as input parameters for the query.

items.description: Fields of the record to use as input parameters for the query.

loop-over.description:
Loop over a list of items taken from the record. For instance value.documents.
It must refer to a list of maps. In this case the output-field parameter
but be like "record.fieldname" in order to replace or set a field in each record
with the results of the query. In the query parameters you can refer to the
record fields using "record.field".

only-first.description: If true, only the first result of the query is stored in the output field.

output-field.description: The name of the field to use to store the query result.

query.description: The query to use to extract the data.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

re-rank.name: Re-rank
re-rank.description: Agent for re-ranking documents based on a query.

algorithm.description: Algorithm to use for re-ranking. 'none' or 'MMR'.

field.description: The field that contains the documents to sort.

max.description: Maximum number of documents to keep.

output-field.description: The field that will hold the results, it can be the same as "field" to override it.

query-embeddings.description: Field that contains the embeddings of the documents to sort.

query-text.description: Field that already contains the text that has been embedded.

access-key.description: Access key for the S3 server.

bucketName.description: The name of the bucket to read from.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of the S3 server.

file-extensions.description: Comma separated list of file extensions to filter by.

idle-time.description: Time in seconds to sleep after polling for new files.

secret-key.description: Secret key for the S3 server.

sink.name: Kafka Connect Sink agent
sink.description:
Run any Kafka Connect Sink.
    All the configuration properties are passed to the Kafka Connect Sink.

connector.class.description: Java main class for the Kafka Sink connector.

source.name: Kafka Connect Source agent
source.description:
Run any Kafka Connect Source.
    All the configuration properties are passed to the Kafka Connect Source.

connector.class.description: Java main class for the Kafka Source connector.

text-extractor.name: Text extractor
text-extractor.description: Extracts text content from different document formats like PDF, JSON, XML, ODF, HTML and many others.

make-lowercase.description: Whether to make the text lowercase.

trim-spaces.description: Whether to trim spaces from the text.

chunk_overlap.description:
RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter splitter option. Chunk overlap of the previous message.
Checkout https://github.com/knuddelsgmbh/jtokkit for more details.

chunk_size.description:
RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter splitter option. Chunk size of each message.
Checkout https://github.com/knuddelsgmbh/jtokkit for more details.

keep_separator.description:
RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter splitter option. Whether or not to keep separators.
Checkout https://github.com/knuddelsgmbh/jtokkit for more details.

length_function.description:
RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter splitter option. Options are: r50k_base, p50k_base, p50k_edit and cl100k_base.
Checkout https://github.com/knuddelsgmbh/jtokkit for more details.

separators.description:
RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter splitter option. The separator to use for splitting.
Checkout https://github.com/knuddelsgmbh/jtokkit for more details.

items.description:
RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter splitter option. The separator to use for splitting.
Checkout https://github.com/knuddelsgmbh/jtokkit for more details.

splitter_type.description: Splitter implementation to use. Currently supported: RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter.

unwrap-key-value.name: Unwrap key-value format
unwrap-key-value.description: If the record value is in KeyValue format, extracts the KeyValue's key or value and make it the record value.

composable.description: Whether this step can be composed with other steps.

unwrapKey.description: Whether to unwrap the key instead of the value.

when.description:
Execute the step only when the condition is met.
You can use the expression language to reference the message.
Example: when: "value.first == 'f1' && value.last.toUpperCase() == 'L1'"

vector-db-sink_astra.name: Cassandra/Astra
vector-db-sink_astra.description:
Writes data to Apache Cassandra or DataStax Astra service.
All the options from DataStax Kafka Sink are supported: https://docs.datastax.com/en/kafka/doc/kafka/kafkaConfigTasksTOC.html

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'astra'.

keyspace.description: The keyspace of the table to write to.

mapping.description: Comma separated list of mapping between the table column and the record field. e.g. my_colum_id=key, my_column_name=value.name.

table-name.description: The name of the table to write to. The table must already exist.

vector-db-sink_cassandra.name: Cassandra/Astra
vector-db-sink_cassandra.description:
Writes data to Apache Cassandra or DataStax Astra service.
All the options from DataStax Kafka Sink are supported: https://docs.datastax.com/en/kafka/doc/kafka/kafkaConfigTasksTOC.html

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'cassandra'.

keyspace.description: The keyspace of the table to write to.

mapping.description: Comma separated list of mapping between the table column and the record field. e.g. my_colum_id=key, my_column_name=value.name.

table-name.description: The name of the table to write to. The table must already exist.

vector-db-sink_jdbc.name: JDBC
vector-db-sink_jdbc.description: Writes data to any JDBC compatible database.

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'jdbc'.

fields.description: Fields of the table to write to.

items.description: Fields of the table to write to.

expression.description: JSTL Expression for computing the field value.

primary-key.description: Is this field part of the primary key?

table-name.description: The name of the table to write to. The table must already exist.

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'milvus'.

items.description: Fields definition.

expression.description: JSTL Expression for computing the field value.

vector-db-sink_opensearch.name: OpenSearch
vector-db-sink_opensearch.description: Writes data to OpenSearch or AWS OpenSearch serverless.

batch-size.description: Batch size for bulk operations. Hitting the batch size will trigger a flush.

pipeline.description:
The pipeline ID for preprocessing documents.
Refer to the OpenSearch documentation for more details.

routing.description:
Routes the request to the specified shard.
Refer to the OpenSearch documentation for more details.

require_alias.description:
Set to true to require that all actions target an index alias rather than an index.
Refer to the OpenSearch documentation for more details.

refresh.description:
Whether to refresh the affected shards after performing the indexing operations. Default is false. true makes the changes show up in search results immediately, but hurts cluster performance. wait_for waits for a refresh. Requests take longer to return, but cluster performance doesnâ€™t suffer.
Note that AWS OpenSearch supports only false.
Refer to the OpenSearch documentation for more details.

wait_for_active_shards.description:
Specifies the number of active shards that must be available before OpenSearch processes the bulk request. Default is 1 (only the primary shard). Set to all or a positive integer. Values greater than 1 require replicas. For example, if you specify a value of 3, the index must have two replicas distributed across two additional nodes for the request to succeed.
Refer to the OpenSearch documentation for more details.

timeout.description:
How long to wait for the request to return.
Refer to the OpenSearch documentation for more details.

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'opensearch'.

items.description: Index fields definition.

expression.description: JSTL Expression for computing the field value.

id.description: JSTL Expression to compute the index _id field. Leave it empty to let OpenSearch auto-generate the _id field.

index-name.description: The name of the index to write to. The index must already exist.

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'pinecone'.

vector.id.description: JSTL Expression to compute the id.

vector.metadata.description: Metadata to append. The key is the metadata name and the value the JSTL Expression to compute the actual value.

vector.namespace.description: JSTL Expression to compute the namespace.

vector.vector.description: JSTL Expression to compute the vector.

vector-db-sink_solr.name: Solr
vector-db-sink_solr.description:
Writes data to Solr service.
    The collection-name is configured at datasource level.

datasource.description: Resource id. The target resource must be type: 'datasource' or 'vector-database' and service: 'solr'.

items.description: Fields definition.

expression.description: JSTL Expression for computing the field value.

webcrawler-source.name: Web crawler source
webcrawler-source.description: Crawl a website and extract the content of the pages.

access-key.description:
Configuration for handling the agent status.
Access key for the S3 server.

allowed-domains.description: Domains that the crawler is allowed to access.

items.description: Domains that the crawler is allowed to access.

bucketName.description:
Configuration for handling the agent status.
The name of the bucket.

endpoint.description:
Configuration for handling the agent status.
The S3 endpoint.

forbidden-paths.description: Paths that the crawler is not allowed to access.

items.description: Paths that the crawler is not allowed to access.

handle-robots-file.description: Whether to scan the HTML documents to find links to other pages.

max-error-count.description: Maximum number of errors allowed before stopping.

max-unflushed-pages.description: Maximum number of unflushed pages before the agent persists the crawl data.

max-urls.description: Maximum number of URLs that can be crawled.

min-time-between-requests.description: Minimum time between two requests to the same domain. (in milliseconds)

region.description:
Configuration for handling the agent status.
Region for the S3 server.

reindex-interval-seconds.description: Time interval between reindexing of the pages.

scan-html-documents.description: Whether to scan HTML documents for links to other sites.

secret-key.description:
Configuration for handling the agent status.
Secret key for the S3 server.

seed-urls.description: The starting URLs for the crawl.

items.description: The starting URLs for the crawl.

user-agent.description: User agent to use for the requests.

datasource_astra.name: Astra
datasource_astra.description: Connect to DataStax Astra Database service.

database.description: Astra Database name to connect to. If secureBundle is provided, this field is ignored.

secureBundle.description: Secure bundle of the database. Must be encoded in base64.

token.description: Astra Token (AstraCS:xxx) for connecting to the database. If secureBundle is provided, this field is ignored.

contact-points.description: Contact points of the cassandra cluster.

datasource_jdbc.name: JDBC
datasource_jdbc.description: Connect to any JDBC compatible database. The driver must be provided as dependency. All the extra configuration properties are passed as is to the JDBC driver.

datasource_opensearch.name: OpenSearch
datasource_opensearch.description: Connect to OpenSearch service or AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless.

host.description:
Host parameter for connecting to OpenSearch.
Valid both for OpenSearch and AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless.

https.description: Whether to use https or not.

password.description:
Basic authentication for connecting to OpenSearch.
In case of AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless, this is the secret key.

port.description: Port parameter for connecting to OpenSearch service.

region.description: Region parameter for connecting to AWS OpenSearch Service/Serveless.

username.description:
Basic authentication for connecting to OpenSearch.
In case of AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless, this is the access key.

access-key.description: The access key to use for "api" provider.

api-url.description: The URL of the Hugging Face API. Relevant only if provider is "api".

model-check-url.description: The model url to use. Relevant only if provider is "api".

provider.description: The provider to use. Either "local" or "api".

open-ai-configuration.name: Open AI
open-ai-configuration.description: Connect to OpenAI API or Azure OpenAI API.

provider.description: The provider to use. Either "openai" or "azure".

url.description: Url for Azure OpenAI API. Required only if provider is "azure".

vector-database_astra.name: Astra
vector-database_astra.description: Connect to DataStax Astra Database service.

database.description: Astra Database name to connect to. If secureBundle is provided, this field is ignored.

secureBundle.description: Secure bundle of the database. Must be encoded in base64.

token.description: Astra Token (AstraCS:xxx) for connecting to the database. If secureBundle is provided, this field is ignored.

contact-points.description: Contact points of the cassandra cluster.

host.description: Host parameter for connecting to Milvus.

password.description: Password parameter for connecting to Milvus.

port.description: Port parameter for connecting to Milvus.

token.description: Token parameter for connecting to Zillis service.

url.description: Url parameter for connecting to Zillis service.

user.description: User parameter for connecting to Milvus.

vector-database_opensearch.name: OpenSearch
vector-database_opensearch.description: Connect to OpenSearch service or AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless.

host.description:
Host parameter for connecting to OpenSearch.
Valid both for OpenSearch and AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless.

https.description: Whether to use https or not.

password.description:
Basic authentication for connecting to OpenSearch.
In case of AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless, this is the secret key.

port.description: Port parameter for connecting to OpenSearch service.

region.description: Region parameter for connecting to AWS OpenSearch Service/Serveless.

username.description:
Basic authentication for connecting to OpenSearch.
In case of AWS OpenSearch Service/Serverless, this is the access key.

api-key.description: Api key for connecting to the Pinecone service.

environment.description: Environment parameter for connecting to the Pinecone service.

index-name.description: Index name parameter for connecting to the Pinecone service.

project-name.description: Project name parameter for connecting to the Pinecone service.

server-side-timeout-sec.description: Server side timeout parameter for connecting to the Pinecone service.

vector-database_solr.name: Solr
vector-database_solr.description: Connect to Solr or Solr Cloud service.

host.description: Host parameter for connecting to Solr.

password.description: Password parameter for connecting to Solr.

port.description: Port parameter for connecting to Solr.

user.description: Username parameter for connecting to Solr.

project.description: GCP project name for the Vertex API.

region.description: GCP region for the Vertex API.

serviceAccountJson.description: Specify service account credentials. Refer to the GCP documentation on how to download it

token.description: Access key for the Vertex API.

url.description: URL connection for the Vertex API.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

keyspace.description: Name of the keyspace to create.

create-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to create the keyspace. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to create the keyspace. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

delete-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to cleanup the keyspace. They will be executed when the application is deleted only if 'deletion-mode' is 'delete'.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to cleanup the keyspace. They will be executed when the application is deleted only if 'deletion-mode' is 'delete'.

keyspace.description: Name of the keyspace to create.

cassandra-table.name: Cassandra table
cassandra-table.description: Manage a Cassandra table in existing keyspace.

create-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to create the table. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to create the table. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

delete-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to cleanup the table. They will be executed when the application is deleted only if 'deletion-mode' is 'delete'.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to cleanup the table. They will be executed when the application is deleted only if 'deletion-mode' is 'delete'.

keyspace.description: Name of the keyspace where the table is located.

create-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to create the table. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to create the table. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

delete-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to cleanup the table. They will be executed when the application is deleted only if 'deletion-mode' is 'delete'.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to cleanup the table. They will be executed when the application is deleted only if 'deletion-mode' is 'delete'.

create-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to create the collection. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to create the collection. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

database-name.description: Name of the database where to create the collection.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.
Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.

create-statements.description: List of the statement to execute to create the collection. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

items.description: List of the statement to execute to create the collection. They will be executed every time the application is deployed or upgraded.

datasource.description: Reference to a datasource id configured in the application.
